objectives: Students will discuss technology in daily life using Neutral/Standard register language
Students will engage with Horror themed scenarios related to technology in daily life
Students will demonstrate appropriate use of neutral level vocabulary and expressions
Students will create dialogues combining technology in daily life content with Horror narrative elements

warm_up.description: Students explore technology in daily life through a Horror lens using Neutral/Standard language
warm_up.scenario: Imagine a frightening or supernatural situation involving technology in daily life

main_activities.description: Students learn and practice neutral register vocabulary related to technology in daily life in a horror context
Students engage in horror themed role-play about technology in daily life using neutral register
Students create original horror themed content about technology in daily life in neutral register

discussion_questions: How would you describe technology in daily life in a Horror scenario?
What terror or darkness might be involved in technology in daily life?
Can you create a Horror story about technology in daily life?
How does technology in daily life change when viewed through a Horror perspective?
What neutral register expressions would you use to discuss this horror scenario?

role_play_scenarios.scenario: Horror situation involving technology in daily life
roles: Character A: Using neutral register in horror context
Character B: Responding in neutral register within horror theme

topic_genre_blend: technology in daily life with terror
technology in daily life with darkness
technology in daily life with mysterious

teacher_transformation_guide.register_guidance: Use Neutral/Standard throughout: Standard professional communication
teacher_transformation_guide.genre_guidance: Frame all content with Horror theme: Fear, suspense, supernatural elements

assessment.register_focus: Students demonstrate mastery of Neutral/Standard register
assessment.genre_focus: Students engage with Horror themed content
criteria: Appropriate use of neutral register language
Comprehension of topic within new context

methodology: Augmented CLT with Register & Genre Transformation
